intro: Osteospermum natalense, commonly known as the Natal daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange central disk surrounded by ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Osteospermum natalense is known for its long blooming period, often from spring to autumn.
